diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Possible acute pancreatitis, acute on chronic systolic CHF, Urinary tract infection- e coli
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with epigastric pain following a full meal, accompanied by nausea and vomiting, suggestive of pancreatic pathology. No prior history of gallbladder or pancreatic issues was noted. Ultrasound findings of cholelithiasis without cholecystitis were present, indicating potential involvement of the biliary system in conjunction with her symptoms. Additional medical history supporting heart failure and diabetes was also relevant.
